decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Ecological Statement (ref JPP0723-L-2012-001b), Flood Risk Assessment (ref WFP:1349969501) October 2012 Received 07/10/2014, Operational Management Plan (ref 1037-01) November 2014, 0943-01-022 Received 27/02/2015) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The hereby approved use of the site shall be undertaken in accordance with the submitted Operational Management Plan (ref 1037-01) November 2014

Condition : 4 - In accordance with the approved Operational Management Plan (ref 1037-01) November 2014, refuse and recycling waste from the residential moorings shall be stored on board vessels and collected weekly by the moorings management company for disposal at the existing refuse/recycling facilities within the Ferry Quays development.

Condition : 5 - No more than nine boats shall be moored at the site. Each shall be moored in accordance with plan 0943-01-022. The boats moored at the site shall be restricted to a single level of accommodation with no superstructure exceeding two metres in height.
Condition : 6 - Each mooring shall be provided with a means of access to mains electricity when the development hereby approved is first implemented and permanently retained thereafter.
Condition : 7 - The occupants of the vessels using the moorings hereby approved shall not use generators and no maintenance shall be carried out on a boat while moored at the site.
description: Change of use of existing leisure moorings to permanent residential moorings with the provision of visitor mooring to the south of the lock gates
